workflow.name: Create a N and design a barrier
workflow.author: Huijie Qiao and Luis Escobar
workflow.message: This workflow is used to create a N using an ellipsoid in E space, and desigh a barrier in G space.

function.name: Step 1. Generate principal components
function.message: PCA, and draw background cloud with the first 3 PCs.

function.name: Step 2.1. Draw background cloud (BC) from a folder
function.message: After generating PCs, You can find a 'background' folder in your saved PCA folder. This folder can be used to draw the background cloud directly.

function.name: Step 2.2. Draw background cloud (BC) from two or three environmental layers
function.message: If you didn't generate PCs, you can use any two/three environmental layers to draw the background cloud.

function.name: Step 3. Create a virtual N
function.message: After drawing an ellipsoid using the widgets on the left side of the form, you can generate a virtual N with this function.

function.name: Step 4. Open the virtual N
function.message: Once you generate a virtual N, you can open it via selecting the folder of the N.

function.name: Step 5. Design barriers
function.message: After opening the N, you can design a barrier for it.

function.name: Step 6. Open a part of the virtual N based on the barrier
function.message: After designing a barrier, two folders contain the occurrence points inside and outside of the barrier will be saved in the N folder. Select and open it in NicheA!

function.name: Step 7. Export to ENMs
function.message: Export the selected N to another ENM software.

function.name: Step 8. Threshold variables
function.message: After modeling N, you need a threshold to binary the model's result.

function.name: Step 9. Open the ENM's result
function.message: After modeling N, you can open the result in NicheA. In this time, you need to select the raster distribution file, rather than the N folder, and set an appropriate threshold value.
